intro: Thibaudia engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
